channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OpenOffice
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OpenOffice

item.title: CVE-2021-40439|2024-08-04T02:44:10.415Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openoffice
item.description: Apache OpenOffice has a dependency on expat software. Versions prior to 2.1.0 were subject to CVE-2013-0340 a "Billion Laughs" entity expansion denial of service attack and exploit via crafted XML files. ODF files consist of a set of XML files. All versions of Apache OpenOffice up to 4.1.10 are subject to this issue. expat in version 4.1.11 is patched.

item.title: CVE-2021-41831|2024-08-04T03:22:24.979Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openoffice
item.description: It is possible for an attacker to manipulate the timestamp of signed documents. All versions of Apache OpenOffice up to 4.1.10 are affected. Users are advised to update to version 4.1.11. See CVE-2021-25634 for the LibreOffice advisory.

item.title: CVE-2021-41830|2024-08-04T03:22:24.927Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openoffice
item.description: It is possible for an attacker to manipulate signed documents and macros to appear to come from a trusted source. All versions of Apache OpenOffice up to 4.1.10 are affected. Users are advised to update to version 4.1.11. See CVE-2021-25633 for the LibreOffice advisory.

item.title: CVE-2021-41832|2024-08-04T03:22:24.932Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openoffice
item.description: It is possible for an attacker to manipulate documents to appear to be signed by a trusted source. All versions of Apache OpenOffice up to 4.1.10 are affected. Users are advised to update to version 4.1.11. See CVE-2021-25635 for the LibreOffice advisory.
